title.narrative: Scale-up of emergency education, life-saving humanitarian nutrition, WASH and child protection services to address the most immediate needs of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs), in Afar Amhara and Tigray regions.

description.narrative: The main objective of this UNICEF project is to scale-up up emergency education, life-saving humanitarian nutrition, Water, Sanitation and Hygiene, and child protection services to address the most immediate needs of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs), in Afar Amhara and Tigray regions. UNICEF and its partners under education will provide displaced out-of-school children (50 percent girls) with essential learning materials, tents, pre-primary, and primary accelerated opportunities linked with psychosocial support and child protection. Under the Child Protection component, UNICEF will address the critical gaps in child protection services through case management, workforce availability and capacity; Gender-based violence (GBV) response, and prevention and mental health and psychosocial service (MHPSS) provision. Nutrition will cover early detection and referral of children with severe acute malnutrition (SAM) for treatment, Supplementation with Vitamin A, promotion of infant and young child feeding in an emergency (IYCF-E), Provision of high-energy biscuits (HEBs) to the vulnerable pregnant and lactating women (PLWs) and Iron and Folic Acid supplementation of pregnant women during antenatal visits. Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene component will provide water through emergency water trucking as well as rehabilitation of water systems, construction of emergency latrines with handwashing facilities, and promotion of hygiene practices and distribution of life-saving WASH non-food items (NFI). The project provides life-saving assistance to 509,751 people, including 96352 women, 921 men, 207,505 girls, 204,973 boys, and 21,925 persons with disabilities

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Children and families have access to critical life-saving child protection services including case management, MHPSS and access to life-saving supplies and cash assistance
